isis.stitle: DT/DTI-466 A and B Series DT/DTI/DTA-466 C Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - ENGINE DIAGNOSTIC TEST PROCEDURES - DT/DTI - 466 A AND B SERIES DIESEL ENGINES - ACCELERATOR LINKAGE DT/DTI-466 A and B Series (With UTDS Model 100 Fuel Injection Pump) - Inspect Throttle Linkage

step1.para: Inspect all accelerator and linkage controls for proper connection and freedom of movement. Replace or repair as necessary.

important.para: ENGINE MOUNTED LINKAGE ASSEMBLIES USE NYLON BUSHINGS AND BALL JOINTS WHICH DO NOT REQUIRE LUBRICATION.

step1.para: Injection pump lever override is the adjustment which compensates for linkage wear and for chassis motion during operation. If lever over-travel is not maintained, high idle and consequently maximum performance will not be obtained.

step2.para: Depress the accelerator pedal to the high idle position. The inner portion of injection pump lever must be in the high idle position (maximum pump control shaft clockwise travel).

Check the position of the tang protruding through the slot in the outer portion of the lever.The tang should be located halfway between the center and the end of the slot. (See Figure 5.3)
. Be sure the tang does not touch the end of the slot as this could result in internal pump damage.
If the proper tang location is not obtained, linkage adjustment if required.

step1.para: Linkage adjustment -- without engine mounted linkage.

step2.para: Adjust the accelerator control cable length to obtain the required over-travel at high idle. (See Figure 5.3).

step1.para: Linkage adjustment -- with engine mounted linkage.

step2.para: Disconnect the throttle cable (or throttle rod) from the bellcrank linkage. Remove the return springs.

Check the pump lever location at the high idle position (no over-travel). The outermost lever hole must be 8.57 ± .12 from front finish of the crankcase. (See Figure 5.4
). Reposition the lever if required and tighten the clamping bolt to 55 lbf-in. (6 N.m).

Check the bellcrank shaft centerline. The shaft must be located 19.52 ± .06 from the front face of the flywheel housing or cranking motor pad. If required, loosen the bellcrank bracket mounting bolts and adjust the bracket to obtain the correct shaft location. (See Figure 5.4).

Check the control rod length. With the pump lever held in the low idle position (no over-travel), a .188 ± .0005 (3/16 drill) gauge pin must be able to enter the gauge holes on the control lever and bellcrank bracket. (See Figure 5.4).
If the gauge holes are not in-line, adjust the control rod length as follows:

step3.para: Disconnect the upper ball joint from the control lever.
Align the control lever and bellcrank bracket gauge holes and insert the gauge pin through the holes.
Loosen the control rod jam nuts. With the pump lever held in the low idle position (no over-travel), adjust the control rod length so that the upper ball joint enters the control lever hole squarely.
Reassemble the upper ball joint to the control lever and remove the gauge pin.
Tighten the control rod nuts making sure that the ball joints are aligned (not twisted). Do not use Loctite sealant.

caution.para: MAKE SURE THERE IS SUFFICIENT THREAD ENGAGEMENT IN EACH BALL END. (SEE FIGURE 5.5).

step2.para: Attach the accelerator control cable/rod to the proper control lever hole location. (See Figure 5.6).
Recheck the injection pump lever over-travel per items 2a and b. If the correct tang location is not obtained, adjust the accelerator cable/rod length as required.
If equipped with automatic transmission, attach and adjust the modulator cable as follows:

step3.para: Push modulator cable "in" to the far end of modulator travel.
Push the injection pump control lever to the high idle position. Do not push the pump lever into the over-travel position.
Adjust the cable extension to the seat of the swivel and secure the locknut.

important.para: BEFORE STARTING THE ENGINE, ENTER THE OPERATOR'S COMPARTMENT AND DEPRESS THE THROTTLE PEDAL SEVERAL TIMES TO CHECK FOR SMOOTH ACTION AND FULL RETURN OF THE THROTTLE LEVER AND THROTTLE PEDAL. THIS MUST BE DONE ANY TIME COMPONENTS ARE REPLACED, REASSEMBLED OR ADJUSTED.

caution.para: INJECTION PUMP CONTROL LEVER MUST BE FREE TO RETURN TO LOW IDLE POSITION REGARDLESS OF MODULATOR POSITION.
